ext_time.h

00001 /*
00002  *  ext_time.h
00003  *
00004  *  Copyright 2008 Cycling '74. All rights reserved.
00005  *
00006  */
00007 
00008 #ifndef __EXT_TIME_H__
00009 #define __EXT_TIME_H__
00010 
00011 BEGIN_USING_C_LINKAGE
00012 
00013 /**
00014  Flags that determine attribute and time object behavior
00015  @ingroup time
00016 */
00017 enum {
00018     TIME_FLAGS_LOCATION = 1,        ///< 1 1 0 location-based bar/beat/unit values (as opposed to interval values, which are 0 0 0 relative)
00019     TIME_FLAGS_TICKSONLY = 2,       ///< only ticks-based values (not ms) are acceptable
00020     TIME_FLAGS_FIXEDONLY = 4,       ///< only fixed values (ms, hz, samples) are acceptable
00021     TIME_FLAGS_LOOKAHEAD = 8,       ///< add lookahead attribute (unsupported)
00022     TIME_FLAGS_USECLOCK = 16,       ///< this time object will schedule events, not just hold a value
00023     TIME_FLAGS_USEQELEM = 32,       ///< this time object will defer execution of scheduled events to low priority thread
00024     TIME_FLAGS_FIXED = 64,          ///< will only use normal clock (i.e., will never execute out of ITM)
00025     TIME_FLAGS_PERMANENT = 128,     ///< event will be scheduled in the permanent list (tied to a specific time)
00026     TIME_FLAGS_TRANSPORT = 256,     ///< add a transport attribute
00027     TIME_FLAGS_EVENTLIST = 512,     ///< add an eventlist attribute (unsupported)
00028     TIME_FLAGS_CHECKSCHEDULE = 1024,    ///< internal use only
00029     TIME_FLAGS_LISTENTICKS = 2048,      ///< flag for time_listen: only get notifications if the time object holds tempo-relative values
00030     TIME_FLAGS_NOUNITS = 4096,          ///< internal use only
00031     TIME_FLAGS_BBUSOURCE = 8192,        ///< source time was in bar/beat/unit values, need to recalculate when time sig changes
00032     TIME_FLAGS_POSITIVE = 16384         ///< constrain any values < 0 to 0
00033 };
00034 
00035 
00036 
00037 /**
00038  Stop a currently scheduled time object.
00039  
00040  @ingroup   time
00041  @param     x               The time object.
00042 
00043 */
00044 void time_stop(t_object *x);
00045 
00046 
00047 /**
00048  Execute a time object's task, then if it was already set to execute, reschedule for the current interval value of the object.
00049  
00050  @ingroup   time
00051  @param     x               The time object.
00052  
00053 */
00054 void time_tick(t_object *x);
00055 
00056 
00057 /**
00058  Convert the value of a time object to milliseconds.
00059  
00060  @ingroup   time
00061  @param     x               The time object.
00062  @return                    The time object's value, converted to milliseconds.
00063 */
00064 double time_getms(t_object *x);
00065 
00066 
00067 /**
00068  Convert the value of a time object to ticks.
00069  
00070  @ingroup   time
00071  @param     x               The time object.
00072  @return                    The time object's value, converted to ticks.
00073 */
00074 double time_getticks(t_object *x);
00075 
00076 
00077 /**
00078  Return the phase of the ITM object (transport) associated with a time object.
00079  
00080  @ingroup   time
00081  @param     tx              The time object.
00082  @param     phase           Pointer to a double to receive the progress within the specified time value of the associated ITM object.
00083  @param     slope           Pointer to a double to receive the slope (phase difference) within the specified time value of the associated ITM object.
00084 */
00085 void time_getphase(t_object *tx, double *phase, double *slope);
00086 
00087 
00088 /**
00089  Specify that a millisecond-based attribute to be updated automatically when the converted milliseconds of the time object's value changes.
00090  
00091  @ingroup   time
00092  @param     x               The time object.
00093  @param     attr            Name of the millisecond based attribute in the owning object that will be updated
00094  @param     flags           If TIME_FLAGS_LISTENTICKS is passed here, updating will not happen if the time value is fixed (ms) based
00095  */
00096 void time_listen(t_object *x, t_symbol *attr, long flags);
00097 
00098 
00099 /**
00100  Set the current value of a time object (either an interval or a position) using a Max message.
00101  
00102  @ingroup   time
00103  @param     tx              The time object.
00104  @param     s               Message selector.
00105  @param     argc            Count of arguments.
00106  @param     argv            Message arguments.
00107  */
00108 void time_setvalue(t_object *tx, t_symbol *s, long argc, t_atom *argv);
00109 
00110 /**
00111  Create an attribute permitting a time object to be changed in a user-friendly way.
00112  
00113  @ingroup   time
00114  @param     c               Class being initialized.
00115  @param     attrname        Name of the attribute associated with the time object.
00116  @param     attrlabel       Descriptive label for the attribute (appears in the inspector)
00117  @param     flags           Options, see "Flags that determine time object behavior" above
00118 */
00119 void class_time_addattr(t_class *c, char *attrname, char *attrlabel, long flags);
00120 
00121 /**
00122  Create a new time object.
00123  
00124  @ingroup   time
00125  @param     owner           Object that will own this time object (task routine, if any, will pass owner as argument).
00126  @param     attrname        Name of the attribute associated with the time object.
00127  @param     tick            Task routine that will be executed (can be NULL)
00128  @param     flags           Options, see "Flags that determine time object behavior" above
00129  @return                    The newly created time object.
00130 */
00131 void *time_new(t_object *owner, t_symbol *attrname, method tick, long flags);
00132 
00133 /**
00134  Return a time object associated with an attribute of an owning object.
00135  
00136  @ingroup   time
00137  @param     owner           Object that owns this time object (task routine, if any, will pass owner as argument).
00138  @param     attrname        Name of the attribute associated with the time object.
00139  @return                    Time object associated with the named attribute.
00140 */
00141 t_object *time_getnamed(t_object *owner, t_symbol *attrname);
00142 
00143 
00144 void time_enable_attributes(t_object *x);
00145 
00146 /**
00147  Return whether this time object currently holds a fixed (millisecond-based) value.
00148  
00149  @ingroup   time
00150  @param     x               Time object.
00151  @return                    True if time object's current value is fixed, false if it is tempo-relative.
00152 */
00153 long time_isfixedunit(t_object *x);
00154 
00155 
00156 /**
00157  Schedule a task, with optional quantization.
00158  
00159  @ingroup   time
00160  @param     x               The time object that schedules temporary events (must have been created with TIME_FLAGS_USECLOCK but not TIME_FLAGS_PERMANENT)
00161  @param     quantize        A time object that holds a quantization interval, can be NULL for no quantization.
00162 */
00163 void time_schedule(t_object *x, t_object *quantize);
00164 
00165 
00166 /**
00167  Schedule a task, with optional minimum interval, 
00168  
00169  @ingroup   time
00170  @param     x               The time object that schedules temporary events (must have been created with TIME_FLAGS_USECLOCK but not TIME_FLAGS_PERMANENT)
00171  @param     quantize        The minimum interval into the future when the event can occur, can be NULL if there is no minimum interval.
00172 */
00173 void time_schedule_limit(t_object *x, t_object *quantize);
00174 
00175 /**
00176  Schedule a task for right now, with optional quantization.
00177  
00178  @ingroup   time
00179  @param     x               The time object that schedules temporary events. The time interval is ignored and 0 ticks is used instead.
00180  @param     quantize        A time object that holds a quantization interval, can be NULL for no quantization.
00181 */
00182 void time_now(t_object *x, t_object *quantize);
00183 
00184 
00185 /**
00186  Return the ITM object associated with this time object.
00187  
00188  @ingroup   time
00189  @param     ox              Time object.
00190  @return                    The associated ITM object.
00191 */
00192 void *time_getitm(t_object *ox);
00193 
00194 
00195 /**
00196  Calculate the quantized interval (in ticks) if this time object were to be scheduled at the current time.
00197  
00198  @ingroup   time
00199  @param     ox              Time object.
00200  @param     vitm            The associated ITM object (use time_getitm() to determine it).
00201  @param     oq              A time object that holds a quantization interval, can be NULL.
00202  @return                    Interval (in ticks) for scheduling this object.
00203 */
00204 double time_calcquantize(t_object *ox, void *vitm, t_object *oq);
00205 
00206 
00207 /**
00208  Associate a named setclock object with a time object (unsupported).
00209  
00210  @ingroup   time
00211  @param     tx              Time object.
00212  @param     sc              Name of an associated setclock object.
00213 */
00214 void time_setclock(t_object *tx, t_symbol *sc);
00215 
00216 END_USING_C_LINKAGE
00217 
00218 #endif // __EXT_TIME_H__
